meanings.sent1: In some ancient cultures, zoolatry was a common practice.
meanings.sent2: Her zoolatry extended to all creatures, big and small.
meanings.sent3: The zoolatry of the cat resulted in it being treated like royalty in the household.
meanings.sent4: His zoolatry for the majestic lion was evident in his admiration for its strength.
meanings.sent5: The zoolatry of the tribe towards the sacred elephant was deeply ingrained in their traditions.

meanings.definition: The belief in or worship of animals.
meanings.sent1: Modern zoolatry often involves conservation efforts for endangered species.
meanings.sent2: Her zoolatry led her to volunteer at the local animal shelter.
meanings.sent3: The zoolatry of the children towards their pet rabbit was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: His zoolatry for the graceful swan inspired him to create beautiful artwork.
meanings.sent5: The zoolatry of the community towards the mystical unicorn was a symbol of unity.
